std.value: Students in Class One are talking about how to protect the environment. Miss Li asks, "What can we do to stop the trees from being cut down?" Mary raises her hand and says, "By using less paper because paper is made from wood." "Good idea." Miss Li says, "What measures can we take to use less paper?" Mary smiles and answers, "Miss Li, would you please give us fewer papers in tests and assignments? That'll be a great way to save trees." Miss Li feels really embarrassed and at a loss for words.

std.value: Students in Class One are talking about how to protect the environment. The teacher asks what measures we can take to reduce the number of trees cut down every year. One girl volunteers to offer an answer, saying that is we can cut down on the use of paper. The teacher is satisfied with the answer and asks how to make that possible. Students are lost in thought when the girl gives an unexpected answer. She suggests the teacher give out less test papers and handouts. The classroom burst into laughter.

std.value: Students in Class One are talking about how to protect the environment. The teacher asks, "How can we cut down less trees to save the earth?" Xiao Lin is eager to give her answer. "Why not launch a campaign to save on paper in office buildings and schools?" She says. The teacher then asks her to give more explanations of the details. After thinking for a while, Xiao Lin grins and says, "If the teachers hand out less test papers and give less homework sheets, we can save many trees." The teacher is not prepared for the answer and looks amused and embarrassed.
